title: Tate Ellington
text:
James Tate Ellington (born April 17, 1979) is an American actor. He portrayed Aidan Hall, the best friend of Tyler Hawkins (<a href="Robert%20Pattinson">Robert Pattinson</a>) in the 2010 romantic drama film "<a href="Remember%20Me%20%282010%20film%29">Remember Me</a>". Ellington starred as Oliver Hunt in "The Elephant King" (2006), and has appeared in television shows such as "<a href="The%20Unusuals">The Unusuals</a>", "<a href="Rescue%20Me%20%28U.S.%20TV%20series%29">Rescue Me</a>", "<a href="The%20Good%20Wife">The Good Wife</a>", and "<a href="Don%27t%20Trust%20the%20B----%20in%20Apartment%2023">Don't Trust the B---- in Apartment 23</a>". He appeared in the 2009 <a href="Broadway%20theatre">Broadway</a> production of "<a href="The%20Philanthropist%20%28play%29">The Philanthropist</a>", which starred <a href="Matthew%20Broderick">Matthew Broderick</a>. He is best known for his role as <a href="Federal%20Bureau%20of%20Investigation">FBI</a> recruit Simon Asher on the <a href="American%20Broadcasting%20Company">ABC</a> thriller "<a href="Quantico%20%28TV%20series%29">Quantico</a>". Beginning September 25, 2017, Ellington joined the main cast of <a href="National%20Broadcasting%20Company">NBC</a>'s new drama "<a href="The%20Brave%20%28TV%20series%29">The Brave</a>". He played Noah Morgenthau in the military thriller, which was one of the first two new series announced by NBC for the 2017–18 season.
Early life.
Ellington is from <a href="Madison%2C%20Mississippi">Madison, Mississippi</a>, the son of Deborah (Cochran) and James R. Ellington, who own a residential construction company. He received his high school education at the private <a href="Madison-Ridgeland%20Academy">Madison-Ridgeland Academy</a>, in Madison, where he graduated in 1997. While at MRA, he was a starting <a href="Center%20%28American%20football%29">center</a> for the school's <a href="American%20football">football</a> team for three seasons.
Upon graduation from MRA, Ellington enrolled as a double major in art and theater at the <a href="University%20of%20Mississippi">University of Mississippi</a> (also known as "Ole Miss"), after turning down a <a href="scholarship">scholarship</a> to the <a href="Savannah%20College%20of%20Art%20and%20Design">Savannah College of Art and Design</a>. He graduated from Ole Miss with a <a href="bachelor%27s%20degree">bachelor's degree</a> in theatre performance and was a member of the <a href="Sigma%20Chi">Sigma Chi</a> fraternity.
Awards.
Ellington won Best Actor for his role in "The Elephant King" at the 2006 <a href="Brooklyn%20International%20Film%20Festival">Brooklyn International Film Festival</a>.
Personal life.
On May 20, 2012, Ellington married casting director Chrissy Fiorilli at the Dixie Gin in <a href="Shreveport%2C%20Louisiana">Shreveport, Louisiana</a>.
